Posts.Content: 4tylove wrote: I really need your input.  I have searched the internet, asked friends with bc, asked my onc, but to know avail.  No one has heard of my problem.  I have been finished with chemo and radiation since August and my hair is about 3 inches long now.  It has grown in very curly and thicker than the very thick straight hair I had prior to chemo.  My problem is actually two things that seem to happen simultaneously... severe scalp pain along with tinnitis (very loud ringing in ears).  Although I have had slight ringing for years, I have had nothing like this and the scalp pain is terrible.  It comes and goes... maybe I won't have it for several days and I think it has gone away completely, but here it comes again... every bit as painful as the the time before.  It hurts to brush or run my fingers through my hair and I can't sleep because it hurts when my head presses against my pillow.  Has anyone had a similar experience?  I had pain when I lost my hair too, but it subsided once all the hair was gone.  When it started happening again several months ago, I thought it must be a normal side effect of hair regrowth, but after looking on the internet and talking to my doctor, no one seems to have a clue.  Do any of you know of what I speak?  Many thanks to you for any words of wisdom you might have.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scalp Pain 4tylove DiamondGirl
